generated.description: This is an autogenerated partial class definition of 'ReactorTimeConstant'

description*.en: The "Reactor Time Constant", also called the reactor period, is the time during which the neutron flux density in a reactor changes by the factor e = 2.718 (e: basis of natural logarithms), when the neutron flux density increases or decreases exponentially.

title: ReactorTimeConstant
description: The "Reactor Time Constant", also called the reactor period, is the time during which the neutron flux density in a reactor changes by the factor e = 2.718 (e: basis of natural logarithms), when the neutron flux density increases or decreases exponentially.
